uniol.apt.analysis.reversible

Class ReversibleTS

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.reversible.ReversibleTS

  • public class ReversibleTS
extends java.lang.Object
    An LTS is reversible if the initial state can be reached from every state that is reachable within the system.
    Author:
    Vincent GÃ¶bel, Uli Schlachter

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public final void check()
        Checks the system for reversibility. If it is not reversible a counterexample is saved in the variable node_.

      • check

        public boolean check(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the node corresponding to the checked state
        Returns:
        False iff the state is reachable, but not reversible

      • getUnreversibleStates

        public java.util.Set<State> getUnreversibleStates()
        Returns:
        A Set of all unreversible states in the LTS

      • isReversible

        public boolean isReversible()
        Returns:
        true, if the LTS is reversible, or false, if it is not

      • getNode

        public State getNode()
        Returns:
        A non-reversible state, if one exists.
